Package com.ktzvhad.rents.repository

Class DonatorsRepository

java.lang.Object
com.ktzvhad.rents.repository.DonatorsRepository
@Repository public class DonatorsRepository extends Object
The H2Dao class is responsible for handling all database operations for the H2 database. This includes CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the 'ateret' table and any other necessary data manipulation required by the application.

This class utilizes JdbcTemplate for database interactions, simplifying JDBC operations and converting SQL exceptions into Spring's DataAccessException hierarchy.

  • Method Details

    • writeDonationsFromExcelToDB

      public void writeDonationsFromExcelToDB(List<Map<String,Object>> data, Long userId)
      Inserts a list of donation data into the 'ateret' table. Each donation record is mapped from the provided list of key-value pairs to the corresponding columns in the database.

      The method uses a batch operation to efficiently insert multiple records at once. If an error occurs during the insertion, it logs detailed information about the failure, including any SQL exceptions.

      The following fields are inserted for each donation: - date_pledged: The date when the donation was pledged. - donor_name: The name of the donor. - donated_for: The purpose or cause for which the donation was made. - pledge_amount: The amount pledged by the donor. - parsha_name: The Parsha (Torah portion) associated with the donation. - remarks: Additional notes or remarks for the donation. - paid: The amount paid by the donor. - paid_to: The recipient to whom the payment was made. - payment_date: The date when the payment was made. - current_amount: The current outstanding balance for the donation.

      Parameters:
      data - A list of maps, where each map represents a donation record with key-value pairs corresponding to the donation fields.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the donations.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if an error occurs while accessing the database.

    • updatePaymentDetails

      public boolean updatePaymentDetails(Long ateretId, BigDecimal paymentSum, String paidTo, Long userId)
      Updates the payment details for a specific donation record in the 'ateret' table. The update includes the payment amount, the recipient of the payment, and the current date as the payment date. The method logs the outcome of the operation and returns whether the update was successful.

      Fields updated: - paid: The amount paid by the donor. - paid_to: The recipient of the payment. - payment_date: The date when the payment was made, set to the current date.

      Parameters:
      ateretId - The ID of the donation record to update.
      paymentSum - The amount paid.
      paidTo - The recipient to whom the payment was made.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the donation.
      Returns:
      true if the payment details were successfully updated; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if an error occurs during the database update.

    • writeExpendituresFromExcelToDB

      public void writeExpendituresFromExcelToDB(List<Map<String,Object>> data, Long userId)
      Inserts a list of expenditure data from an Excel file into the 'expenditures' table. Maps each expenditure record from the provided list into the table's columns, including the expenditure date, donor name, remarks, payment amount, and associated user ID.

      The method uses batch processing to insert multiple rows efficiently.

      Fields processed: - expenditure_date: The date the expenditure was made. - donor_name: The name of the donor associated with the expenditure. - remarks: Any additional information related to the expenditure. - paid: The amount paid for the expenditure. - userId: The ID of the user associated with the expenditure.

      Parameters:
      data - List of maps, each representing an expenditure record with key-value pairs corresponding to column names and values.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the expenditures.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if an error occurs during the batch update.

    • calculateTotalPaidForUser

      public BigDecimal calculateTotalPaidForUser(Long userId)
      Calculates the total amount paid by a specific user from the 'ateret' table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose total paid amount is being calculated.
      Returns:
      The total paid amount as a BigDecimal, or BigDecimal.ZERO if no records are found.

    • calculateTotalExpensesForUser

      public BigDecimal calculateTotalExpensesForUser(Long userId)
      Calculates the total expenses for a specific user from the 'expenditures' table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose total expenses are being calculated.
      Returns:
      The total expenses as a BigDecimal, or BigDecimal.ZERO if no records are found.

    • getAllDonations

      public List<DonatorResponse> getAllDonations(Long userId)
      Retrieves all donation records for a specific user from the 'ateret' table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose donation records are being retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of DonatorResponse objects representing the user's donations.

    • getAllDonateDataPaginated

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<DonatorResponse> getAllDonateDataPaginated(Long userId, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Retrieves paginated donation data for a specific user from the 'ateret' table. This method supports pagination, retrieving donation records in pages using limit and offset.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose donations are being retrieved.
      pageable - The Pageable object containing pagination information (page number and size).
      Returns:
      A Page object containing a list of DonatorResponse objects and pagination details.

    • getAllExpenses

      public List<ExpansesResponse> getAllExpenses(Long userId)
      Retrieves all expense records for a specific user from the 'expenditures' table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose expense records are being retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of ExpansesResponse objects representing the user's expenses.

    • generateFilteredReport

      public List<ReportDTO> generateFilteredReport(Long userId)
      Generates a report of donations, aggregating data by donor name and calculating the maximum current amount donated. This method also assigns unique numbers to each donor based on their appearance in the `unique_numbers` table. If the table does not exist, it creates the table and ensures each donor receives a unique number.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose donations are being aggregated.
      Returns:
      A list of ReportDTO objects containing the aggregated donation data and unique numbers for each donor.

    • deleteRowById

      public boolean deleteRowById(Long id)
      Deletes a donation record from the 'ateret' table based on the provided ID. This method removes the record from the database if it exists.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the donation record to delete.
      Returns:
      true if one or more rows were affected, indicating successful deletion; false otherwise.

    • editRowById

      public boolean editRowById(Long id, DonatorResponse donatorResponse)
      Updates an existing donation record in the 'ateret' table based on the provided ID and DonatorResponse object. This method updates fields such as the donation amount, donor name, and other relevant details.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the donation record to update.
      donatorResponse - DonatorResponse object containing the updated donation data.
      Returns:
      true if one or more rows were affected, indicating successful update; false otherwise.

    • addNewDonationRecord

      public boolean addNewDonationRecord(DonatorResponse newRecord, Long userId)
      Adds a new donation record to the 'ateret' table. This method inserts a new record with the provided data and associates it with the specified user.
      Parameters:
      newRecord - DonatorResponse object containing the new donation data.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with this donation record.
      Returns:
      true if the record was successfully added; false otherwise.

    • addPaymentRecord

      public boolean addPaymentRecord(PaymentResponse newPayment, Long userId)
      Adds a new payment record to the 'payments' table. This method inserts the payment details such as donor name, amount paid, and recipient, and associates it with the specified user.
      Parameters:
      newPayment - PaymentResponse object containing the payment details.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with this payment record.
      Returns:
      true if the record was successfully added; false otherwise.

    • addExpenditureRecord

      public boolean addExpenditureRecord(ExpenditureResponse expenditure, Long userId)
      Adds a new expenditure record to the 'expenditures' table. This method inserts the expenditure details such as date, donor name, amount paid, and remarks.
      Parameters:
      expenditure - ExpenditureResponse object containing the expenditure details.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with this expenditure record.
      Returns:
      true if the record was successfully added; false otherwise.

    • getMemberDetails

      public List<MemberResponse> getMemberDetails(Long userId)
      Retrieves member details for a specific user from the 'members' table. The method returns a list of MemberResponse objects containing member details such as name, contact, and address.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user associated with the members.
      Returns:
      List of MemberResponse objects representing the member details.

    • addMember

      public boolean addMember(Member newMember, Long userId)
      Adds a new member to the 'members' table. This method inserts the personal details of the member such as name, phone, email, and address.
      Parameters:
      newMember - Member object containing the new member's details.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with this member.
      Returns:
      true if the member was successfully added; false otherwise.

    • addContactUsMessage

      public boolean addContactUsMessage(ContactUsDetail contactDetail, Long userId)
      Adds a new contact us message to the 'contactUsDetails' table. This method inserts the contact details provided by the user, including donor name, email, and message.
      Parameters:
      contactDetail - ContactUsDetail object containing the details of the contact message.
      userId - The ID of the user associated with this contact message.
      Returns:
      true if the contact message was successfully added; false otherwise.
